content.description:
Smears, slopers and a few edges lead up the outer face of the flake with

Rip it Up

and then join that problem for it finish up easy face to the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Center of the narrow west face and just right of

Rip it Up

.

content.description:
Delicate friction and edging up a slab gain the blunt arete where tenuous liebacking gains better holds and the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the southwest face.

content.description:
Lieback up the easy but grainy flake and continue up easy face to top out.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the narrow west face.

content.description:
Fun moves up shallow huecos to a rounded topout. The descent for the boulder is just to right down the slot.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Center of the narrow south face.
